Interface_name: WebSocket Server - side by using Tornado in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a WebSocket server using Tornado in Python to handle WebSocket connections, messages, and disconnections.

Class Description: The WebSocketServer class initializes and starts a Tornado-based WebSocket server that listens on a specified port. It uses a WebSocketHandler to manage individual WebSocket connections.

Attributes:
- port: int - The port number on which the WebSocket server will listen.
- app: tornado.web.Application - The Tornado application instance that routes WebSocket connections.
- server: tornado.httpserver.HTTPServer - The HTTP server instance that serves the WebSocket application.

Methods:
- __init__(port: int = 8080) -> None - Initializes the WebSocketServer with the specified port (default: 8080).
- start() -> None - Starts the WebSocket server and begins listening for incoming connections.

Class Description: The WebSocketHandler class extends tornado.websocket.WebSocketHandler to handle WebSocket connection events.

Methods:
- open() -> None - Called when a new WebSocket connection is opened.
- on_message(msg: str) -> None - Called when a message is received from the WebSocket client.
- on_close() -> None - Called when the WebSocket connection is closed.
- check_origin(origin: str) -> bool - Overrides the origin check to allow connections from any origin (returns True).
